spaceinvaders.server.player

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • spaceinvaders.server.player.Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    A player which has established a connection and is ready to join a game.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player(Connection connection, java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService connectionExecutor)
      Wrap a player around the specified connection.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(Connection connection,
              java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService connectionExecutor)
        Wrap a player around the specified connection.
        Parameters:
        connection - the part of this player used for network communication.
        connectionExecutor - used to run tasks needed by the connection.
        Throws:
        RejectedExecutionException - if a subtask cannot be executed.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if an arguments is null.

    • Method Detail

      • push

        public void push(Command command)
        Push a command to the client.

        The command is not sent over the network until flush is called.

        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the command is null.

      • pull

        public java.util.List<Command> pull()
        Pull all commands received by the player.
        Returns:
        a list containing all commands received or an empty list if there are none.

      • flush

        public void flush()
        Flush commands to the client.

        All pushed commands are sent over the network.

      • close

        public void close()
        Close the connection.

      • isOnline

        public boolean isOnline()

      • getId

        public int getId()

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String name)

      • getTeamSize

        public int getTeamSize()

      • setTeamSize

        public void setTeamSize(int teamSize)

      • setUdpDestinationPort

        public void setUdpDestinationPort(int port)
        Set the remote port to which UDP packets should be sent.

        This remove port represents the UDP port on which the client is listening. It is not the same port as the one from which the client is sending UDP packets.
